name: Catacombs of Kom El Shoqafa
quote: 'The catacombs lie beneath the western necropolis of Alexandria and consist of three levels cut through solid rock.'

name: Prambanan
quote: 'A Temple dedicated to the TrimÅ«rti, the expression of God as the Creator (Brahma), the Preserver (Vishnu) and the Destroyer (Shiva).'

name: House of Wisdom
quote: 'The center of knowledge during the Islamic Golden Age, the House of Wisdom stored many knowledge and intellect.'

name: Amphitheatrum Flavium
quote: 'The largest ancient amphitheatre ever built, and is still the largest standing amphitheatre in the world, despite its age.'

name: Great Canal
quote: 'A large great canal that connects 2 bodies of water, typically 2 oceans or with a large lake.'

name: Golden Gate Bridge
quote: 'A large bridge of great engineering that attracts many tourists and visitors. Is not actually made of gold.'

name: Burj Khalifa
quote: 'The tallest building in the world, with a total height of 829.8 m (2,722 ft, or just over half a mile).'

name: Three Gorges Dam
uniques: Gain a free [Hydro Plant] [in this city]
quote: 'The largest power station in the world, generating great power for all.'

name: The Sphere
uniques: [+100]% [Culture] [in this city] <during We Love The King Day>
quote: 'A 18,600-seat auditorium marketed for its immersive video and audio capabilities.'

name: Large Hadron Collider
quote: 'The world's largest and highest-energy particle accelerator.'

name: BRP Sierra Madre
quote: 'A warship intentionally run aground to serve as an outpost.'

name: Iron Dome
quote: 'A mobile all-weather air defense system, practically shredding every plane that comes across it.'

name: Vegreville Egg
uniques: Hidden until [2] social policy branches have been completed
quote: 'It's just a massive freakin easter egg, what else is to say?'

name: National Theatre
uniques: Only available <if [Theatre] is constructed in all [non-[Puppeted]] cities>
quote: 'A great theatre which brings pure happiness to the realm.'

name: Potala Palace
uniques: [+5 Culture] [in this city] <starting from the [Modern era]>
quote: 'A dzong fortress that was the winter palace of the Dalai Lamas. Turned into a museum later after it is no longer used and then a world heritage site.'

name: Cure to Cancer
quote: 'A cure to the most devastating disease known to man, this cure will save the lifes of dozens of millions per day.'

name: Kaaba
uniques: [-25]% Faith cost of generating Great Prophet equivalents
quote: 'The Kaaba was rebuilt several times throughout history, most famously by Ibrahim and his son Ismail, when he returned to the valley of Mecca several years after leaving his wife Hajar and Ismail there upon Allah's command. Circling the Kaaba seven times counterclockwise, known as Tawaf, is a Fard rite for the completion of the Hajj and Umrah pilgrimages.'

name: Motherland Calls
uniques: Earn [10]% of the damage done to [All] units as [Gold]
quote: 'A colossal neoclassicist and socialist realist war memorial sculpture made to commemorate fallen soldiers.'

name: Monks Mound
quote: 'A large earthwork and apparently also a sort of pyramid.'

name: Apostolic Palace
quote: 'A large palace that serves as the home of the leader of the faith.'

name: Bronze Horseman
quote: 'A large bronze statue of a great leader ontop of the largest pedestal in the world.'

name: Alyosha Monument
uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Production, +1 Gold] from [Taiga] tiles [in this city]
[+2 Food, +2 Production, +1 Gold] from [Snow] tiles [in this city]
quote: 'A large statue and monument to the soldiers who faught bravely in a very cold war.'

name: Wat Phra Kaew
uniques: [+1 Faith, +1 Gold] from [improved] tiles [in this city]
quote: 'A sacred temple located within a royal palace.'

name: Rushmore
uniques: Creates a [Mount Rushmore] improvement on a specific tile
Must have an owned [Mountain] within [2] tiles
quote: 'I want you, Mr. President, to dedicate this memorial as a Shrine to Democracy; to call upon the people of the earth for one hundred thousand years to come to read the thought and to see what manner of men struggled here to establish self-determined government in the western world.'
